text.0: rousing the lands where mens five tribes are settled dawn hath disclosed the pathways of the people.
text.1: she hath sent out her sheen with beauteous oxen the sun with light hath opened earth and heaven.
text.2: they paint their bright rays on the skys far limits the dawns come on like tribes arrayed for battle.
text.3: thy cattle closely shutting up the darkness as savitar spreads his arms give forth their lustre.
text.4: wealthy most like to indra dawn hath risen and brought forth lauds that shall promote our welfare.
text.5: daughter of heaven a goddess she distributes best of aṅgirases treasures to the pious.
text.6: bestow on us o dawn that ample bounty which thou didst send to those who sang thy praises.
text.7: thou whom with bellowings of a bull they quickened thou didst unbar the firmset mountains portals.
text.8: impelling every god to grant his bounty sending to us the charm of pleasant voices.
text.9: vouchsafe us thoughts for profit as thou breakest preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
